definitions.definition: to force somebody to do something that they do not want to do, by making threats
to do something too soon, before the right time
to cause the plans of an opponent to fail
to refuse to change your mind about something even when other people are trying to persuade you that you are wrong

examples.text: I'm really under the gun today.

wordOrigin: Middle English gunne, gonne, perhaps from a pet form of the Scandinavian name Gunnhildr, from gunnr + hildr, both meaning ‘war’.
